snippet: The claim by militants in Afghanistan was a sign that the Islamic State’s central command is increasingly willing to promote its Afghan affiliate as a supported group.
abstract: Islamic State militants claim responsibility for attack near Pakistani Consulate in Jalalabad, Afghanistan, that killed at least seven Afghan soldiers; episode offers sign that Islamic State's central command is beginning to promote its Afghan affiliate and that group's violent campaign is starting to move into urban areas.

byline.original: By KHALID ALOKOZAY and MUJIB MASHAL
byline.contributor: Khalid Alokozay reported from Jalalabad, and Mujib Mashal from Kabul, Afghanistan. Rukmini Callimachi contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The claim by militants in Afghanistan was a sign that the Islamic State’s central command is increasingly willing to promote its Afghan affiliate as a supported group.

headline.main: ISIS Claims Assault That Killed 7 Near Pakistani Consulate in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: ISIS Claims Responsibility for Assault That Killed 7 Afghans

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
